reviews.review:
I first experianced Portal on the Xbox when the Orange box was initially released, returning again when Portal 2 was released and then playing once (dozens) more on the PC. This game is amazing and really flexes the brain, with low res (for computers that can't handle high end graphics which is amazing and considerate) to hours of consistant game play with custom maps, and so much more. This game is fun for those that like puzzles and puzzle solving, working alone or with others, amazing story and of course cake! I would suggest this game is worth the price and will keep you coming back for more every time. 20/10. 

TL:DR This game is amazing, very much so would suggest anyone to play.
Good game, good story, and also good music. It's  an artistic product.

С детства обожала Portal и всё время играла в неё. Рада, что добавили кооператив и можно ломать голову вместе с другом. Минусов, как я думаю, нету. игра просто чудесная. Вы не пожалеете о потраченых деньгах, ведь за такой качественый продукт и не жалко 400 рублей. Ставлю 5 порталов из 5!!

Not sure if I can say anything that is entirely different than any other reviewer but I can say that I cannot think of any other game that makes me feel more stupid while struggling to solve one of these mind-bending levels nor does any other game  make me feel more like a genius when I solve such a level. It is incredibly rewarding mentally without needing constant weapon/armor/gear upgrades. Splendidly clever narrative instructional dialogue. You can tell the developers had a fun time creating this game. 10/10 satisfying experience.

it's soooo goooood

and when i got into the single player i had a blast. its a really uniqe setting which i belive helps the game being so special and good.

Portal 2 is a game that's amazingly well made, the puzzles are pretty challenging sometimes and the game really requires some thinking. The story is set up really well with a nice mixtured of humor in it. The gameplay is solid, reliable and really really good. Portal 2 is an amazing follow up to the original Portal. And maybe the best thing about Portal 2 is that you can keep playing it as much as you want because of all the workshop content. 

Pros:
-Solid and reliable mechanics
-Nice puzzles
-Great concept
-Good level design
-Workshop content

Cons:
-None

Rating: 10/10

I just finished the single-player campaign with only a few peeks at walkthroughs and it was the exact level of challenging + satisfying that I was hoping for. There is far more room for thoughtful, slow puzzle-solving (with bursts of exhilarating movement and aha! moments) than Portal 1 (which I revisited and, yeah, the earliest puzzles with shifting built-in portals and timed events are actually more difficult in a "man, this is annoying" kind of way).

Co-op is differently lovely and was incredibly fun, but having a more focused/experienced partner helped a lot. Sometimes my partner would figure out a path to the exit before I could figure out what was going on, so we'd leave and I'd be clueless. This lends a lot of replay value (the cutscenes are short and as usual, no respawn penalty, so restarting from level one doesn't seem daunting or exhausting), as with each different partner, you'll figure out different things in a different order with each partner having different or new strengths. Sometimes you use your partner pretty much as a moveable weighted cube, just standing on things or pushing buttons you're told to push while the other guy does all the thinking. Sometimes real collaboration and timing is a necessity. Balancing of each partner's strengths and weaknesses becomes a real aspect of the game and leads to actual, in-reality, relationship-building. Your frustration or reliance on (or competitive streak against) the other character carries over into how you cooperate in real life via voice comm to progress.

The access to Steam Workshop community maps makes this game endlessly playable, even if co-op may eventually wear thin after a few run-throughs with different people. There are some excellent maps out there, and ones which introduce different architecture than what you're used to--new approaches to vertical gameplay or problem-solving methods.

Portal 2. This and the first Portal are games I've wanted to play for a while now. I got a laptop for Christmas this year, and I'm FINALLY able to play these two amazing games. The test chambers are challenging and the place you're in, (Aperture Science, which will always be better than Black Mesa :3) is BEAUTIFUL. This is a guy who doesn't care about graphics much, but good golly gravy is this game amazing looking. Not just that, but the voices for GLaDOS and Wheatley, Ellen McLain and Stephen Merchant, do an amazing job. Also, J.K. Simmons is amazing in this as Cave Johnson. That lemon speech is the funniest thing he says. Well, Wheatley really takes the cake for humor. And its not a lie. The writing for him is my favorite, and even when something happens that I won't spoil, he is hilarious. Only thing left for me to say is if you HAVEN'T played this game, play it if you can. It's something I think you'll enjoy. (Especially if you love robots)

[h1][b]Superb! 10/10[/b][/h1]
[b][u]Awesome games! It's very interesting definitely [i]worth buying one or two[/i][/u][/b]

[b][u]Portal 2.. what is this game?[/u][/b]
[b]It is a puzzle games which requires one to think for a moment in silence or so.. it also had an unusual play style which you're going to use to solve the puzzles in game.. which is can be very fun or quite frustating[/b]

[b][u]Portal 2 have a great graphics[/u][/b] ([b]*[/b]of course that being said it's not in the same league with games such as Crysis 3 for example from my Library like say.. Dead Island)
It [b][u]have controller support[/u][/b] so if you have controller.. fire away I guess (not sure, haven't really test it out)
It [b][u]have "CO-OP"[/u][/b] which mean you can play it with one of your friends ([b]*[/b]It have err.. voice chat in game so you may communicate with your friends better of course you can turn it off if you want)
The Story..
[b]*[/b]I have not played the first Portal so I don't really know what's going on the story.. but Portal 2 manage to.. kinda tell me what's been going on the Portal Universe so I can understand what's going on and when they crack some jokes.. I actually laugh at those jokes, it's hilarious! The characters in game are become very likeable as you progress through the story. So overall I think [b][u]Portal 2 has pretty great story[/u][/b]

Que dire de ce jeu, il est au top et digne du portal premier du nom! L'histoire ce suit et on retouve de nouvelle égnime plus dur que dans le 1.

Question durer de vie, l'histoire principal est assez prenante et pour ma part, j'y ai passer 8 heures d'affilé sans m'en rendre compte, donc jusqu'a que j'ai le générique de fin. Après il y a les modes défis comme dans le 1 mais il sont moins prenant pour ma part, part contre on peut ce comparé a tout le monde et surtout ces amis ce qui et vraiment bien. Bande son vraiment bien, et graphiquement au top.

La nouvauté est le mode multi joueurs, bien conçu et il faut vraiment avoir une bonne coop sinon on perd du temps.

Bref que du plus pour un jeu qui a de quoi nous tenir pendant des heures, si on en a envie.

ENJOY ;)
